remarks: A sequence that consists entirely of zeroes (or whatever the identity ` Z ` is for operation ` .+ ` ) sums to zero.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Dec-2014.)
statement:
seqid3.1 $e |- ( ph -> ( Z .+ Z ) = Z ) $.
seqid3.2 $e |- ( ph -> N e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) ) $.
seqid3.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. ( M ... N ) ) -> ( F ` x ) = Z ) $.
seqid3 $p |- ( ph -> ( seq M ( .+ , F ) ` N ) = Z ) $.
$d .+ x $.
$d F x $.
$d M x $.
$d N x $.
$d Z x $.
$d ph x $.
